BORING GAME!

PROS: 
-Having characters from other horror games and movies is what made me buy this game and what makes this game unique. But that's the only good thing about this game.

CONS: 
- It's repetitive, chasing people who will use pallets to slow you down, when you slash them a few times they will fall down and you can hook them on a pole. Wash rinse repeat.
- Lack of third person, what's the point of having these unique horror characters if you cant see them and their awesome animations when they slay their prey? The devs will never add this and there's no Workshop support for modders to make it a reality.
- If enjoyed in the movies how Michael nailed to the wall his victims with his chef knife or how Freddy in the dream world turns into weird creatures and can change to area into a whole new location, well you won't see this in the game. You won't see many of the amazing abilities of characters that you see in the movies.
- The community is completely shutdown to any new ideas that can improve the game, the community are close minded fanboys that will keep this lackluster game buried from ever improving.

Don't buy this game! it's not the horror all stars game that you imagine it is, it's dull and uninspired. I'm requesting a refund.

Resolvi escrever algo mais apropriado pra esse jogo, primeiramente o jogo se trata de um jogo online onde os sobreviventes precisam consertar geradores e abrirem o portão de saída para assim poderem escapar do mapa, o assassino precisa impedir que os sobreviventes façam tal coisa sacrificando eles em ganchos que ficam espalhados pelo mapa, sendo assim 4x1, o jogo possui um gráfico bem simples, creio eu que pra que seja possível rodar em vários tipos de configurações de PC; mesmo os mais simples, possui bastante conteúdo, assassinos e sobreviventes muito famosos de filmes de terror que você provavelmente conhece, oque torna a experiência muito boa, o jogo é bem cuidado e está sempre recebendo conteúdo novo e atualizações com novos personagens e mapas, jogar tanto com assassino quanto sobreviventes pode parecer muito difícil mas é realmente uma questão de prática, cada sobrevivente e assassino possui habilidades únicas, algumas boas outras ruins como em todo jogo, porém você tem a opção de selecionar qual habilidade quer usar além de itens que podem te ajudar durante as partidas, a progressão funciona com pontos que você adquire durante as partidas e gasta pra subir o nível do seu personagem pra adquirir novas habilidades e novos itens pra usar.

Jogo muito bom! divertido! principalmente se for jogar com os amigos!
 
OBS: Esse negócio vicia hem!

Concluindo... recomendo bastante pra quem gosta de filmes de terror e jogos online!
Unos cuantos bugs pero es un juegazo

inb4 3K hours and still posting a negative review. Reviews are to help new players make a decision. And this game is horrible as a new player. 

-The grind is insane. Even with all my hours I still haven't maxed (P3 all perks) all the characters.
-The tutorial is not good. Sure, playing the tutorial can help a new player know what to do in their first game but that's where it's usefulness ends.
-Devs are incompetent. Nerfing killers that don't need to nerfed and ignoring garbage-tier killers. Skins are optional but it's still insulting that they cost so much. 
-Servers are garbage and favor the killer unfairly. Killers who use a VPN to play on other regions can make the game unenjoyable. It's a rare occurrence but it does happen.

O jogo é divertido mas claramente desbalanceado. Independente dos perks, o assassino sempre terá a vantagem. Se ele for experiente e tiver melhorias boas, a vitória pode ser esmagadora. Enquanto isso a maior desvantagem dos sobreviventes se deve ao trabalho de equipe (naturalmente difícil) e a uma comunicação extremamente limitada a apontar em uma direção. Mesmo com os melhores equipamentos e vantagens a vitória é difícil. Jogar de sobrevivente só é divertido com um time completo de 4 e usando discord.

Epic, I also love to mention the steam tutorials on this game are priceless. If you're going to download this game do it for that. Everything else is pretty shit. I spent about 20min laughing after I read a tutorial about how to play killers and one named "Jeff" and a Bing image of a guy smiling was there.

Horror in games (and films) is too often characterized by jump scares; shocking, startling events designed to trigger a fight-or-flight response. Dead by Daylight, to its credit, eschews these in favor of real horror--a gradual increase in tension resulting from the unshakable sense of impending doom. That it manages to do this in an asymmetrical competitive action game is what is truly impressive about it.

Dead by Daylight features two teams--four survivors and one killer--and pits them against one another in a battle for all the marbles: The four survivors need to repair five generators to power the gates which will allow them to escape. The killer needs to find the survivors, knock them down, put them on hooks and then sacrifice them to the Entity. The odds are skewed heavily in favor of the invincible killer, and as a result playing Dead by Daylight as a survivor can be a nerve-rattling, sweat-inducing, terrifying experience.

After queuing into a game with three other survivors, Dead by Daylight puts you in one of several eerie horror environments and tells you, very simply, to fix the generators to escape. When you find the generators, you then need to repair them--a painstakingly slow process, where you hold the left mouse button down while crouching in front of it. If you're alone, repairing the generator can take more than a minute. As you crouch next to the very noisy generator, the game will throw skill-tests at you by way of a rotating bar--if you fail the QTE, the generator will backfire. This creates a noisy explosion, and the killer is visually alerted to the location of the backfire, turning you into a target.

If the killer does find you (and he probably will) your options are limited. If you have a flashlight you can blind him temporarily, but your best bet is to run away. The killer moves faster than you can run, maintaining the traditional horror movie 'ominous walk', but you can slow him down by leaping through windows, or pushing down pallets to block his path. You want to put as many of these obstacles in between the two of you as possible as you flee for your life.

Fortunately for the survivors, a sixth sense mechanic alerts them to the presence of a nearby killer--the closer the killer is, the faster your survivor's heart beats. Unfortunately the sound is obscured by generator revving as you repair it. When 90% repaired, the generator nearly drowns out the heartbeat entirely, forcing you to rely solely on your eyes to see the killer.

When you play as the killer, you're able to see all the map's generators at all times, allowing you to patrol them. If any of them are making noise, you know at least one survivor has been working on it, and you can hunt for signs that the others are nearby. Panicked survivors will sprint away, leaving scratches on nearby walls and breaks in the grass, and you can follow these markings to find your prey. Once you find your prey you chop them down, pick them up and put them on a hook, sacrificing them to your god after 60 seconds.

The scoring system initially encourages players to create exciting game play opportunities by rewarding risky play. Survivors who engage in lengthy, drawn out chases escaping the killer will earn more points for their boldness, and you can rack up the points by rescuing other survivors who have been captured but not yet sacrificed. As a killer you're rewarded for killing more of the survivors, although a single sacrifice is counted as a victory. Inevitably though, this scoring system leads to immersion-breaking actions like exploiting the killer's slow movement past obstacles, as survivors earn huge points by taunting their hunter.

Dead by Daylight executes the concept of a competitive horror game well. As players become more familiar with both roles, the horror dissipates and they begin to play for the competitive element alone. The matchmaking and game play have stayed significantly incredible and it is a fantastic game for friends to work together to accomplish a goal. It is a completely original concept for a game and it is executed incredibly well. I give this game a 9/10.
